intro: Ardisia pittieri, commonly known as the Colombian beautyberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Ardisia pittieri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
